physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Buccal-facial-mandibular movements, ballistic-type movements when walking, tonic contractions of the neck resulting in hyperextension. Mental status included a belligerent attitude, extreme thought blocking, poverty of speech, derailment, auditory hallucinations, and well-developed delusions.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially showed improvement in tardive dyskinesia symptoms with reserpine, evidenced by a decrease in AIMS score. However, upon discontinuation of reserpine, symptoms worsened significantly, with buccal-facial-mandibular movements that interfered with speech and severe tonic contractions of the neck leading to exaggerated hyperextension.
Tardive dyskinesia symptoms worsened after 8 months of reserpine therapy compared to the state of the condition when off medication.

After 7 weeks from last outpatient follow-up, there was recurrence of buccal-facial-mandibular involuntary movements. At a later examination, the patient showed exacerbated symptoms of tardive dyskinesia.
